trans-unit.source: Creating an Azure Worker Role with Service Bus Queue Project
trans-unit.target: Creating an Azure Worker Role with Service Bus Queue Project

trans-unit.source: <token>wazvstools1</token> supports the <newTerm>Azure Worker Role with Service Bus Queue</newTerm> project template type.
trans-unit.target: <token>wazvstools1</token> supports the <newTerm>Azure Worker Role with Service Bus Queue</newTerm> project template type.

trans-unit.source: You can use this template to add a worker role to your <token>azure_1</token> application that receives messages from a <token>sb2</token> queue.
trans-unit.target: You can use this template to add a worker role to your <token>azure_1</token> application that receives messages from a <token>sb2</token> queue.

trans-unit.source: For more information about project templates in the <token>wazvstools1</token>, see <externalLink><linkText>Creating an Azure Project with Visual Studio</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ee405487.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about project templates in the <token>wazvstools1</token>, see <externalLink><linkText>Creating an Azure Project with Visual Studio</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ee405487.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Creating a Service Bus queue worker role
trans-unit.target: Creating a Service Bus queue worker role

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to create a <token>sb2</token> queue worker role.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to create a <token>sb2</token> queue worker role.

trans-unit.source: The code is based on the <externalLink><linkText>.NET Multi-Tier Application Using Service Bus Queues</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/cloud-services-dotnet-multi-tier-app-using-service-bus-queues/</linkUri></externalLink> tutorial, but replaces the worker role creation in that tutorial with one that uses the <token>sb2</token> project template in the <token>wazvstools2</token>.
trans-unit.target: The code is based on the <externalLink><linkText>.NET Multi-Tier Application Using Service Bus Queues</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/cloud-services-dotnet-multi-tier-app-using-service-bus-queues/</linkUri></externalLink> tutorial, but replaces the worker role creation in that tutorial with one that uses the <token>sb2</token> project template in the <token>wazvstools2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Azure configuration manager
trans-unit.target: Azure configuration manager

trans-unit.source: <token>azure_1</token> contains APIs in the SDK that provide a consistent way for developers to create new instances of clients across services, such as <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: <token>azure_1</token> contains APIs in the SDK that provide a consistent way for developers to create new instances of clients across services, such as <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: The new <embeddedLabel>Service Bus Queue Worker Role</embeddedLabel> project template uses these APIs in the generated code.
trans-unit.target: The new <embeddedLabel>Service Bus Queue Worker Role</embeddedLabel> project template uses these APIs in the generated code.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the configuration changes, see <embeddedLabel>Configuration Changes</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the configuration changes, see <embeddedLabel>Configuration Changes</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Install the <token>wazvstools2</token>
trans-unit.target: Install the <token>wazvstools2</token>

trans-unit.source: To install the <token>wazvstools1</token>, see the section <externalLink><linkText>Installing the Azure Tools for Microsoft Visual Studio</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff687127.aspx#Install</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To install the <token>wazvstools1</token>, see the section <externalLink><linkText>Installing the Azure Tools for Microsoft Visual Studio</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ff687127.aspx#Install</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: If you have already installed the <token>wazvstools2</token>, proceed to the next step.
trans-unit.target: If you have already installed the <token>wazvstools2</token>, proceed to the next step.

trans-unit.source: Build the MultiTier application
trans-unit.target: Build the MultiTier application

trans-unit.source: Perform the steps in <externalLink><linkText>.NET Multi-Tier Application Using Service Bus Queues</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/cloud-services-dotnet-multi-tier-app-using-service-bus-queues/</linkUri></externalLink>, up to (but not including) the “Create the Worker Role” step.
trans-unit.target: Perform the steps in <externalLink><linkText>.NET Multi-Tier Application Using Service Bus Queues</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/cloud-services-dotnet-multi-tier-app-using-service-bus-queues/</linkUri></externalLink>, up to (but not including) the “Create the Worker Role” step.

trans-unit.source: After you have completed the “Create a Web Role” section in the MultiTier tutorial, do not proceed to the “Create the Worker Role” section.
trans-unit.target: After you have completed the “Create a Web Role” section in the MultiTier tutorial, do not proceed to the “Create the Worker Role” section.

trans-unit.source: Instead, proceed to the following step.
trans-unit.target: Instead, proceed to the following step.

trans-unit.source: Create the worker Rrole with Service Bus queue
trans-unit.target: Create the worker Rrole with Service Bus queue

trans-unit.source: In <token>vs_current_short</token>, in Solution Explorer right-click the <ui>Roles</ui> folder under the <ui>MultiTierApp</ui> project.
trans-unit.target: In <token>vs_current_short</token>, in Solution Explorer right-click the <ui>Roles</ui> folder under the <ui>MultiTierApp</ui> project.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Add</ui>, and then click <ui>New Worker Role Project</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Add</ui>, and then click <ui>New Worker Role Project</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Add New Role Project</ui> dialog appears.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Add New Role Project</ui> dialog appears.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Add New Role Project</ui> dialog, click <ui>Worker Role with Service Bus Queue</ui>, as in the following figure:
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Add New Role Project</ui> dialog, click <ui>Worker Role with Service Bus Queue</ui>, as in the following figure:

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Name</ui> box, name the project <userInput>OrderProcessingRole</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Name</ui> box, name the project <userInput>OrderProcessingRole</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Then click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Then click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In Server Explorer, add a connection to the <token>servicensd</token> you want to use, as described in <link xlink:href="1ce0960d-84ae-410f-bc6d-fd231ca46931" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Browsing Service Bus Resources with the Visual Studio Server Explorer</link>.
trans-unit.target: In Server Explorer, add a connection to the <token>servicensd</token> you want to use, as described in <link xlink:href="1ce0960d-84ae-410f-bc6d-fd231ca46931" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Browsing Service Bus Resources with the Visual Studio Server Explorer</link>.

trans-unit.source: In Server Explorer, right-click the name of your <token>servicensd</token>, then click <ui>Properties</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In Server Explorer, right-click the name of your <token>servicensd</token>, then click <ui>Properties</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>vs_current_short</token> <ui>Properties</ui> pane, the first entry contains a connection string that is populated with the <token>servicensd</token> endpoint containing the required authorization credentials.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>vs_current_short</token> <ui>Properties</ui> pane, the first entry contains a connection string that is populated with the <token>servicensd</token> endpoint containing the required authorization credentials.

trans-unit.source: For example, see the following figure.
trans-unit.target: For example, see the following figure.

trans-unit.source: Double-click <ui>ConnectionString</ui>, and then press <userInput>Ctrl+C</userInput> to copy this endpoint to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Double-click <ui>ConnectionString</ui>, and then press <userInput>Ctrl+C</userInput> to copy this endpoint to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the <ui>OrderProcessingRole</ui> you created in the previous step, then click <ui>Properties</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the <ui>OrderProcessingRole</ui> you created in the previous step, then click <ui>Properties</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Settings</ui> tab of the <ui>Properties</ui> dialog, click inside the <ui>Value</ui> box for <ui>Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectionString</ui>, and then paste the endpoint value you copied in step 6.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Settings</ui> tab of the <ui>Properties</ui> dialog, click inside the <ui>Value</ui> box for <ui>Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectionString</ui>, and then paste the endpoint value you copied in step 6.

trans-unit.source: Create an <languageKeyword>OnlineOrder</languageKeyword> class to represent the orders as you process them from the queue.
trans-unit.target: Create an <languageKeyword>OnlineOrder</languageKeyword> class to represent the orders as you process them from the queue.

trans-unit.source: You can reuse a class you have already created.
trans-unit.target: You can reuse a class you have already created.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click <ui>OrderProcessingRole</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click <ui>OrderProcessingRole</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Add</ui>, then click <ui>Existing Item</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Add</ui>, then click <ui>Existing Item</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the subfolder for <embeddedLabel>FrontendWebRole\Models</embeddedLabel>, and double-click <ui>OnlineOrder.cs</ui> to add it to this project.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the subfolder for <embeddedLabel>FrontendWebRole\Models</embeddedLabel>, and double-click <ui>OnlineOrder.cs</ui> to add it to this project.

trans-unit.source: Replace the value of the <codeInline>QueueName</codeInline> variable in WorkerRole.cs from <codeInline>“ProcessingQueue”</codeInline> to <codeInline>“OrdersQueue”</codeInline> as in the following code:
trans-unit.target: Replace the value of the <codeInline>QueueName</codeInline> variable in WorkerRole.cs from <codeInline>“ProcessingQueue”</codeInline> to <codeInline>“OrdersQueue”</codeInline> as in the following code:

trans-unit.source: Add the following <codeInline>using</codeInline> statement at the top of the WorkerRole.cs file:
trans-unit.target: Add the following <codeInline>using</codeInline> statement at the top of the WorkerRole.cs file:

trans-unit.source: In the <codeInline>Run()</codeInline> function, add the following code inside the <codeInline>if (receivedMessage != null)</codeInline> loop, below the <codeInline>Trace</codeInline> statement:
trans-unit.target: In the <codeInline>Run()</codeInline> function, add the following code inside the <codeInline>if (receivedMessage != null)</codeInline> loop, below the <codeInline>Trace</codeInline> statement:

trans-unit.source: You can now run the application by pressing F5 within <token>vs_current_short</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can now run the application by pressing F5 within <token>vs_current_short</token>.

trans-unit.source: Note that the message count does not increment, because the worker role processes items from the queue and marks them as complete.
trans-unit.target: Note that the message count does not increment, because the worker role processes items from the queue and marks them as complete.

trans-unit.source: View the trace output
trans-unit.target: View the trace output

trans-unit.source: You can view the trace output of the worker role by opening the Azure Compute Emulator.
trans-unit.target: You can view the trace output of the worker role by opening the Azure Compute Emulator.

trans-unit.source: To do this, right-click the emulator icon in the notification area of your taskbar and click <ui>Show Compute Emulator UI</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To do this, right-click the emulator icon in the notification area of your taskbar and click <ui>Show Compute Emulator UI</ui>.

trans-unit.source: As you enter data on the website, it is processed in the emulator, as in the following figure:
trans-unit.target: As you enter data on the website, it is processed in the emulator, as in the following figure:
